question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought: There are three days and two reports per day, so the 6 students are divided into three groups of two, one for each day. George must be on Tuesday. Because neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, the only option that has an Olivia or Robert report is B, where Robert is on Monday, so Tuesday must have a different pair, and George is the only remaining choice. Nina gives a report and the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is on Wednesday. Option C has George on Tuesday, so Nina must be on Monday and the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. Therefore, C is the only option that satisfies all the conditions.
full_output:
<think> There are three days and two reports per day, so the 6 students are divided into three groups of two, one for each day. George must be on Tuesday. Because neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, the only option that has an Olivia or Robert report is B, where Robert is on Monday, so Tuesday must have a different pair, and George is the only remaining choice. Nina gives a report and the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is on Wednesday. Option C has George on Tuesday, so Nina must be on Monday and the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. Therefore, C is the only option that satisfies all the conditions.</think>
<ans>C</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle and Lenore do not give reports, then the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively, could be given by
A) Helen, George, and Nina
B) Irving, Robert, and Helen
C) Nina, Helen, and Olivia
D) Olivia, Robert, and Irving
E) Robert, George, and Helen
chain_of_thought: Since George gives a report on Tuesday, and there are two reports on each day, George must give the afternoon report on Tuesday. There are two cases: Case 1: Nina does not give a report. Then Irving must give a report on Tuesday (since George does not) and Helen must give a report on Wednesday (since Irving does not give a report on Wednesday), so the possible reports are Tuesday morning: Irving, Tuesday afternoon: George, Wednesday morning: Helen, Wednesday afternoon: Robert. Case 2: Nina gives a report. Then she must give a report on Monday, and Irving and Helen must give reports on Tuesday. So the possible reports are Monday morning: Nina, Tuesday morning: Irving, Tuesday afternoon: Helen, Tuesday afternoon: George, Wednesday morning: Robert, Wednesday afternoon: Olivia. In both cases, Robert and Helen give a report on Wednesday, so option E is the only one that could be the set of morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday.
full_output:
<think> Since George gives a report on Tuesday, and there are two reports on each day, George must give the afternoon report on Tuesday. There are two cases: Case 1: Nina does not give a report. Then Irving must give a report on Tuesday (since George does not) and Helen must give a report on Wednesday (since Irving does not give a report on Wednesday), so the possible reports are Tuesday morning: Irving, Tuesday afternoon: George, Wednesday morning: Helen, Wednesday afternoon: Robert. Case 2: Nina gives a report. Then she must give a report on Monday, and Irving and Helen must give reports on Tuesday. So the possible reports are Monday morning: Nina, Tuesday morning: Irving, Tuesday afternoon: Helen, Tuesday afternoon: George, Wednesday morning: Robert, Wednesday afternoon: Olivia. In both cases, Robert and Helen give a report on Wednesday, so option E is the only one that could be the set of morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday.</think>
<ans>E</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following is a pair of students who, if they give reports on the same day as each other, must give reports on Wednesday?
A) George and Lenore
B) Helen and Nina
C) Irving and Robert
D) Kyle and Nina
E) Olivia and Kyle
chain_of_thought: George can only give a report on Tuesday, and neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, so George must give a morning report on Tuesday. Nina's report can be either on Monday or Wednesday, so consider each case. Case 1: Nina gives a report on Monday. Then on Tuesday, Helen and Irving must give reports, and George's report is the morning report on Tuesday, so the only remaining report on Tuesday is given by Lenore. On Wednesday, the morning report must be given by either Kyle or Robert, but then the afternoon report must be given by the other. Case 2: Nina gives a report on Wednesday. Then on Monday, Kyle and Robert must give reports, and on Tuesday, George's report is the morning report, so the only remaining report on Tuesday is given by Lenore. On Wednesday, the morning report must be given by either Helen or Irving, but then the afternoon report must be given by the other. In both cases, the only pair of students who must give reports on Wednesday is Kyle and Robert, so C is the correct answer.
full_output:
<think> George can only give a report on Tuesday, and neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, so George must give a morning report on Tuesday. Nina's report can be either on Monday or Wednesday, so consider each case. Case 1: Nina gives a report on Monday. Then on Tuesday, Helen and Irving must give reports, and George's report is the morning report on Tuesday, so the only remaining report on Tuesday is given by Lenore. On Wednesday, the morning report must be given by either Kyle or Robert, but then the afternoon report must be given by the other. Case 2: Nina gives a report on Wednesday. Then on Monday, Kyle and Robert must give reports, and on Tuesday, George's report is the morning report, so the only remaining report on Tuesday is given by Lenore. On Wednesday, the morning report must be given by either Helen or Irving, but then the afternoon report must be given by the other. In both cases, the only pair of students who must give reports on Wednesday is Kyle and Robert, so C is the correct answer.</think>
<ans>C</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If George, Nina, and Robert give reports and they do so on different days from one another, which one of the following could be true?
A) Helen gives a report on Wednesday.
B) Nina gives a report on Monday.
C) Nina gives a report on Tuesday.
D) Olivia gives a report on Monday.
E) Robert gives a report on Wednesday.
chain_of_thought: Since George, Nina, and Robert give reports on different days, and George is on Tuesday, Nina and Robert must be on Monday and Wednesday. Nina's report on Tuesday means Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday, so option A is possible. If Nina gives a report on Monday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, so option B is invalid. Option C is also invalid because Nina cannot give a report on Tuesday without Helen and Irving giving reports on Tuesday. Option D is invalid because Olivia cannot give an afternoon report, and option E is invalid because Robert gives a report on Wednesday. Therefore, option A could be true.
full_output:
<think> Since George, Nina, and Robert give reports on different days, and George is on Tuesday, Nina and Robert must be on Monday and Wednesday. Nina's report on Tuesday means Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday, so option A is possible. If Nina gives a report on Monday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, so option B is invalid. Option C is also invalid because Nina cannot give a report on Tuesday without Helen and Irving giving reports on Tuesday. Option D is invalid because Olivia cannot give an afternoon report, and option E is invalid because Robert gives a report on Wednesday. Therefore, option A could be true.</think>
<ans>A</ans>
